intro: Conceveiba hostmanii, commonly known as the Huayna Picchu ceiba, is a species of ceiba tree native to the cloud forests of Peru. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, buttressed roots and tall, straight trunk. The tree produces showy, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically large and palmately lobed, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to habitat loss, Conceveiba hostmanii is considered endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts in its native range.
